Key Match Events: New Zealand took a big step towards the semi-finals of the Cricket World Cup with a dominant five-wicket win over Sri Lanka in Bangalore.
Rachin Ravindra finally took the final wicket to bowl Sri Lanka all out for 171.
Devon Conway and Ravindra combined for 86, half of the required total, before the pair were dismissed.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The result means New Zealand have all but secured their place in the semi-finals with India, South Africa and Australia.
Others: Only Pakistan, who play England next, and Afghanistan, who take on South Africa, can deny New Zealand a place in the last four.
